spatial_reasoner.cpp
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 /* Libraries */
2 #include "ros/ros.h"
3 #include "miro_teleop/SpatialReasoner.h"
4 #include <cstdio>
5 #include <cmath>
6 
7 /* Definitions */
8 #define PI 3.14159
9 #define NZ 5 // Number of relations (north, south, west, east, distance-to)
10 #define HSIZE 400 // Horizontal map size (in cm)
11 #define VSIZE 400 // Vertical map size (in cm)
12 #define RES 40 // Grid resolution
13 
27 bool SpatialReasoner(miro_teleop::SpatialReasoner::Request &req,
28  miro_teleop::SpatialReasoner::Response &res)
29 {
30  /* Matrices to be sent back to master (mapped in an 1-D array) */
31  std_msgs::Float64 M[NZ*RES*RES];
32 
33  /* Obstacle center obtained from motion capture */
34  double xr = req.center.x;
35  double yr = req.center.y;
36  /* Obstacle dimensions obtained as well */
37  double a = req.dimensions[0].data;
38  double b = req.dimensions[1].data;
39 
40  /* Other definitions */
41  double xp, yp, xq, yq, xv, yv;
42  double angle, beta_min, beta, dist_min, dist;
43  double c_ang, s_ang; // Store cosines and sines to increase performance
44 
45  ROS_INFO("Request received from master node");
46 
47  /* For every element P=(x,y) of the grid, compute the pertinences */
48  for(int x=0;x<RES;x++)
49  {
50  for(int y=0;y<RES;y++)
51  {
52  /* Map indices to actual location on the map */
53  xp = HSIZE/double(2*RES)+HSIZE*(x/double(RES))-HSIZE/2;
54  yp = VSIZE/double(2*RES)+VSIZE*(y/double(RES))-VSIZE/2;
55  /* If P is inside the obstacle, pertinences are null */
56  if((xp>(xr-a/2))&&(xp<(xr+a/2))
57  &&(yp>(yr-b/2))&&(yp<(yr+b/2)))
58  {
59  for(int dir=0; dir<NZ; dir++)
60  M[x+y*RES+dir*RES*RES].data=0;
61  }
62  /* Otherwise, compute with respect to each direction */
63  else
64  {
65  for(int dir=0; dir<NZ-1; dir++)
66  {
67  angle = dir*PI/2; // Direction angle
68  c_ang = cos(angle);
69  s_ang = sin(angle);
70  beta_min = PI/2; // Initial value of beta
71  dist_min = 1000; // Initial value of distance
72 
73  /* For every element of the object calculate */
74  for(int i=0;i<RES;i++)
75  {
76  for(int j=0;j<RES;j++)
77  {
78  // Compute beta and dist
79  xq = xr-a/2+a*(i/double(RES));
80  yq = yr-b/2+b*(j/double(RES));
81  xv = xp-xq;
82  yv = yp-yq;
83  dist = sqrt(xv*xv+yv*yv);
84  if(dist==0) beta=0;
85  else beta =
86  acos((xv*c_ang+yv*s_ang)/dist);
87  // Find minimum values
88  if(beta<beta_min)
89  beta_min = beta;
90  if(dist<dist_min)
91  dist_min = dist;
92  }
93  }
94  /* Update matrices with minimum pertinences */
95  M[x+y*RES+dir*RES*RES].data
96  = fmax(0,1.0-(2.0*beta_min/PI));
97  /* Update the minimum distance of P to object */
98  M[x+y*RES+4*RES*RES].data
99  = fmin(1,fmax(0,dist_min*exp(-dist_min/60)/20));
100  }
101  }
102  }
103  }
104 
105  /* Assign matrices to response structure */
106  for (int i=0;i<NZ*RES*RES;i++) res.matrices.push_back(M[i]);
107 
108  /* Optional: Print matrices */
109  for (int dir=0;dir<NZ;dir++)
110  {
111  ROS_INFO("Printing Matrix %d:",dir+1);
112  for (int i=0;i<RES;i++)
113  {
114  for (int j=0;j<RES;j++)
115  printf("%3.2f ", M[i+j*RES+dir*RES*RES].data);
116  printf("\n");
117  }
118  printf("\n\n");
119  }
120 
121  ROS_INFO("Successfully generated landscapes");
122 
123  return true;
124 }
125 
130 int main(int argc, char **argv)
131 {
132  ros::init(argc, argv, "spatial_reasoning_server");
133  ros::NodeHandle n;
134  ros::ServiceServer service =
135  n.advertiseService("spatial_reasoner", SpatialReasoner);
136  ROS_INFO("Spatial Reasoning service active");
137  ros::spin();
138 
139  return 0;
140 }
